instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no trackpad/keyboard no chime
threads.message:
this one has been wd for few years back. it was apparantly cleaned with IPA. I inspected board everything looks good except <CAPACITOR>C7900</CAPACITOR>/7901 both had ends missing. The two <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> probe points were absolutely eaten away. when i poked them they just crumbled away.

One of the sells is also swallon next to trackpad - I tried new cable for trackpad but no change.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no trackpad/keyboard no chime
threads.message: chime is present. found crap under <CHIP>U4820</CHIP>/4830 flux reflow. I will try new trackpad & keybaord.
